data.title: David Nalbandian 2023 – Net Worth, Salary, Personal Life and Endorsements
data.meta_description: Here's everything you need to know about the personal life, net worth, career of former Argentine professional Tennis player David Nalbandian
data.text:
Here’s everything you need to know about the personal life, net worth, career of former Argentine professional Tennis player David Nalbandian

David Nalbandian Facts

David Nalbandian Career

David Nalbandian retired from Tennis in 2013 after a successful professional career spanning more than a decade. Nalbandian is the only male Argentine player (till date) to reach the semifinals or better at all four Grand Slam tournaments and reached the men’s singles final at Wimbledon. During his illustrious career from 2000-2013, he won 11 singles titles, including the Tennis Masters Cup in 2005 and two Masters 1000 tournaments.

Nalbandian became a part of Tennis folklore in 2007 by becoming the first-ever player to defeat Federer, Nadal and Djokovic in the same tournament. Nalbandian went on to win the ATP Madrid Masters title that edition, registering a thrilling 1-6, 6-3, 6-3 victory against Roger Federer in the final.

It was Nalbandian’s first ATP Masters 1000 title in his career and his sixth ATP title overall. Till date, the big Argentine is the only player to have defeated the ‘Big Three’ of men’s tennis in the same tournament.

Nalbandian achieved a career-best ranking of No. 3 in men’s singles and was the no. 1 Argentine player on the ATP tour for a long time. He officially retired from the sport in 2013 after he was forced to undergo an operation on his right shoulder. In 2021, he joined Serbian player Miomir Kecmanovic as the coach but they parted ways after a short tenure. Nalbandian is currently an active racer in the Argentine Rallying Championship.

Also Read: David Nalbandian once defeated the Big 3, Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic in the same tournament

David Nalbandian Net Worth and Salary

David Nalbandian has an estimated net worth of US$15 million as of 2023. He has earned a total prize money of US$11,114,755 from his professional Tennis career. As a former professional player on the ATP tour, it is understandable that Nalbandian has accumulated a huge amount of wealth. After his retirement from Tennis, Nalbandian switched to car racing and also worked as a professional Tennis coach which contributes a fair portion to his overall net worth.

David Nalbandian Personal Life

David Nalbandian was born on January 1, 1982 in the small city of Unquillo in the Cordoba province of Argentina. He was born to Norberto Nalbandian (father) and Alda Nalbandian (mother). He has two brothers – Javier Nalbandian and Dario Nalbandian. Nalbandian is married to Victoria Bosch and the couple have a daughter together – Sossie Nalbandian. Nalbandian resides with his family in his hometown of Unquillo.

David Nalbandian Endorsements

As a former professional tennis player, David Nalbandian has several endorsement and sponsorship deals in his pocket. During his playing days, the Argentine had endorsement deals with top brands like El Rey David, Galeria, Rally, Fundacion and Contacto. However, his current list of sponsors is not available in the public domain.
